intro: Lyroglossa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy tongue plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers, which are usually violet or purple in color, attract various pollinators including bees and butterflies.
